node.title: 13 Siblings Rescued From Prison Conditions at Home 3 Years Ago Feel 'Betrayed' By System
node.description: There were instances where there was neither a safe place for the children nor food while receiving social services.

node.title: Butterfield Will Not Run for a 10th Term in Congress; Blames Gerrymandering
node.description: "The map that was recently enacted by the legislature is a partisan map. It is racially gerrymandered," Butterfield said in the video announcing his retirement.

node.title: No two-legged intercontinental playoffs for last places at Qatar World Cup
node.description: If Australia has to go in the intercontinental playoffs for the World Cup finals in Qatar, they won't be able to clinch a spot in front of home fans or a hostile away crowd, with FIFA saying playoffs will be one-off games at neutral venues.

node.title: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID cases
node.description: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID-19 cases as the state inches close to its 80 per cent double dose milestone.

node.title: Photographer Mick Rock, known as 'the man who shot the 70s', dies aged 72
node.description: The UK rock photographer, who took iconic images of Lou Reed, Iggy Pop and Queen as well as being David Bowie's official photographer in the early 1970s, is remembered as a "photographic poet".

node.title: Rittenhouse verdict pours fuel on America’s heated gun debate
node.description: Kyle Rittenhouse‘s acquittal for the fatal shootings of racial justice protesters last year spurs strong opinions on both sides of the US gun debate.

node.title: Thousands of protesters march through Melbourne as anti-lockdown, vaccine mandate rallies begin
node.description: Crowds voicing anti-lockdown and anti-vaccine mandate messages have taken to the streets in Melbourne, Sydney and others parts of the country.

node.title: Northern Territory records one new COVID-19 case
node.description: The Chief Minister says the Northern Territory recorded one new case of coronavirus.

node.title: Lukashenko tells BBC: We may have helped migrants into EU
node.description: Belarus's authoritarian leader has told the BBC it is "absolutely possible" his forces helped migrants cross into Poland but denies they were invited.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation," November 21, 2021
node.description: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand and more appear on Sunday's "Face the Nation."

node.title: Elizabeth Holmes takes the stand in her criminal fraud trial
node.description: The decision to have Holmes testify so early in her defense was a bombshell development with considerable risk.

node.title: Watch Dwayne Johnson Chase Ryan Reynolds in ‘Red Notice’
node.description: The director Rawson Marshall Thurber narrates a sequence set in a museum.

node.title: Scams and Slippery Slopes
node.description: Swindling has become a respectable institution in America. How?

node.title: When it comes to self-defense, the burden is often on the prosecution.
node.description: The acquittal of Kyle Rittenhouse points to the wide berth given to defendants who say they acted out of fear.

node.title: F.B.I. Agents Became C.I.A. Operatives in Secret Overseas Prisons
node.description: Lawyers disclosed the unusual arrangement in evidentiary hearings to prepare for the Sept. 11 trial at Guantánamo Bay.

node.title: 1/6 Rioter Allegedly Brought Loaded Gun to Capitol, Filed False Report He Lost It at Casino
node.description: The man reportedly told his family that if authorities came to his house to arrest him, he would give himself up willingly "because I may go down as a hero."

node.title: Chicago School Staffers Removed for Alleged Inappropriate Relations with Students, Cover-Up
node.description: Three adults remain under investigation in alleged inappropriate relationships with students and cover-up, district officials said Friday.

node.title: What's Next for Julius Jones After Execution Is Halted?
node.description: Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt commuted Julius Jones' death sentence Thursday to life in prison without the possibility of parole.

node.title: Political Fight After D.C. Mayor's Shift on Mask Mandate a Microcosm of Broader Battles
node.description: Residents of the capital will no longer need to wear masks in many indoor places on Monday, Nov. 22, but will still be required to do so at a few places.

node.title: Why did David feel like a million mosquitoes were biting his face?
node.description: Researchers are looking for new ways to ease the harmful side effects of a condition that affects around 70 per cent of bone marrow transplant recipients.

node.title: Ex-Green chief of staff to run for Wellington's mayoralty
node.description: Former Green Party chief of staff Tory Whanau has confirmed she'll run for Wellington's mayoralty in next year's local body elections.

node.title: Rare copy of US Constitution sells for $43.2m at auction
node.description: A billionaire investor has outbid an online cryptocurrency group to buy a first-edition copy of the US Constitution for US$43.2 million at Sotheby's auction house.

node.title: Biden fit for duty, polyp removed, says White House physician
node.description: US President Joe Biden's physician says he remains fit for duty after a physical examination and colonoscopy.

node.title: 'The time is now': group disappointed by lack of changes to MIQ
node.description: A network of New Zealanders stuck overseas wants the MIQ system changed, when Auckland's borders are lifted on 15 December.

node.title: Rheumatic fever vaccine funding significant - Heart Foundation
node.description: The Heart Foundation says government funding for a possible rheumatic fever vaccine is an exciting step forward, which could benefit hundreds of people.

node.title: EPA vows action after Houston residents link cancer deaths to rail yard
node.description: Cases of childhood leukemia in Houston's fifth ward are five times higher than the state average, officials say.

node.title: Alex Murdaugh stole almost $5 million, new indictments allege
node.description: Murdaugh, 53, remains in jail without bond after two previous arrests.

node.title: Where Is Peng Shuai?
node.description: The Chinese government must provide answers about the missing tennis star.

node.title: Ford and Rivian no longer plan to work jointly on electric vehicles.
node.description: Ford remains an investor, but its own E.V. development plans have progressed since the partnership was announced.

node.title: Biden Declared ‘Healthy’ and ‘Vigorous’ After His First Presidential Physical
node.description: Vice President Kamala Harris became the first woman to assume acting presidential duties, while President Biden underwent a colonoscopy.
